title: RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Description > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Overview
content:
RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module is a WisBlock Interface module capable of scanning 1D or 2D codes. It uses the LV3296 scanner module from RAKINDA that works on bar codes, QR, and other standard 1D/2D codes.  
LV3296 is connected to the main RAK12018 board via flex cable, which is ideal for different enclosure setups. The RAK12018 also has mounting screw holes dedicated to LV3296, so you can fix it directly to the board making the setup very compact.
parent_content:
RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module is a WisBlock Interface module capable of scanning 1D or 2D codes. It uses the LV3296 scanner module from RAKINDA that works on bar codes, QR, and other standard 1D/2D codes.  
LV3296 is connected to the main RAK12018 board via flex cable, which is ideal for different enclosure setups. The RAK12018 also has mounting screw holes dedicated to LV3296, so you can fix it directly to the board making the setup very compact.

title: RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Mounting > Mounting RAK12018 to WisBlock Base and Connecting LV3296
content:
The RAK12018 module can be mounted to the IO slot of your WisBlock Base board. To illustrate, RAK12018 can be mounted on the IO slot of RAK5005-O WisBlock Base, as shown in **Figure 1**.  
> **Image:** RAK12018 Mounting to WisBlock Base  
LV3296 can be mounted on the RAK12018 board via the mounting screw hole. A 12-pin FPC is used to connect RAK12018 and LV3296 together.
parent_content:
The RAK12018 module can be mounted to the IO slot of your WisBlock Base board. To illustrate, RAK12018 can be mounted on the IO slot of RAK5005-O WisBlock Base, as shown in **Figure 1**.  
> **Image:** RAK12018 Mounting to WisBlock Base  
LV3296 can be mounted on the RAK12018 board via the mounting screw hole. A 12-pin FPC is used to connect RAK12018 and LV3296 together.

title: RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Chipset > Vendor and Part Number Information [TABLE]

RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK12018 WisConnector Pin Definition and Power Management
content:
The RAK12018 has a standard 40-pin WisConnector which can be mounted directly to the IO slot of WisBlock Base board like RAK5005-O. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 2**.  
> **Image:** RAK12018 Pin Definition  
> **TIP:** NOTE
The pins in the module connected to the WisConnector are **3V3_S**, **GND**, **UART** related pins, **NRST**, and **nTRIG**.
parent_content:
The RAK12018 has a standard 40-pin WisConnector which can be mounted directly to the IO slot of WisBlock Base board like RAK5005-O. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 2**.  
> **Image:** RAK12018 Pin Definition  
> **TIP:** NOTE
The pins in the module connected to the WisConnector are **3V3_S**, **GND**, **UART** related pins, **NRST**, and **nTRIG**.  
3V3_S voltage output from the WisBlock Base that powers the RAK12018 module can be controlled by the WisBlock Core via WB_IO2 (WisBlock IO2 pin). This makes the module ideal for low-power IoT projects since the WisBlock Core can totally disconnect the power of the RAK12018 module.

title: RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Mechanical Characteristics > WisConnector PCB Layout > WisConnector PCB Footprint and Recommendations [IMAGE]

RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Schematic Diagram > WisBlock Connector > RAK12018 UART Interfaces and Reset/Trigger Signals
content:
TX_CORE and RX_CORE are UART interfaces to WisBlock Core. NRST is used by the core to reset LV3296. nTRIG is used by the WisBlock Core to provide the module signal to trigger a scan and decode session. This signal can also provide by a key on RAK12018.  
> **Image:** WisBlock Connector
parent_content:
TX_CORE and RX_CORE are UART interfaces to WisBlock Core. NRST is used by the core to reset LV3296. nTRIG is used by the WisBlock Core to provide the module signal to trigger a scan and decode session. This signal can also provide by a key on RAK12018.  
> **Image:** WisBlock Connector

title: RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Schematic Diagram > FPC Connector > FPC Connector for LV3296 Connection
content:

> **Image:** FPC Connector

title: RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Schematic Diagram > nTRIG KEY > LV3296 Module Trigger Signal for Scan and Decode Session
content:
It provides the LV3296 module with a signal to trigger a scan and decode session.  
> **Image:** nTrigger Key

title: RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > RAK12018 WisBlock Code Scanner Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Schematic Diagram > Indicator Light > LED Indicator for Successful Scan
content:
It is used as an LED indicator for a successful scan. This LED is controlled by LV3296.  
> **Image:** Indicator Light

content:
